result.execSummary:
The defendant Allen M. Walber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Emergency 9-1-1 call [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 256.35(10)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Submit to AODA assessment and comply with any recommendations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allen M. Walber

defendant.name: Walber, Allen M.
defendant.address: N8646 E. Wilson Flowage Rd, Phillips, WI 54555

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Allen M. Walber
Current: N8646 E. Wilson Flowage Rd, Phillips, WI 54555 United States  (Effective: 04-08-2022)
Prior: 172 1/2 North Lake Avenue, Phillips, WI 54555

11:02 AM ADA Mark Fuhr calls case and states appearances. Defendant Allen M. Walber appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Fuhr gives status of case. Court questions DE. DE makes comments. The Court gives clarification. DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to each count. DE waives right to attorney. Court questions DE regarding the plea. Court explains charges and max penalties. DE states he would like to consult with an attorney. DA requests time to speak with DE. ADA Fuhr states he told the DE what he would recommend to the Court if he decides to proceed. ADA states the recommendation given to the DE. ADA certifies Victim Rights Compliance. DE re-enters plea of NO CONTEST and wishes to proceed. Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc. ADA Fuhr explains elements of charge. Comments by both parties. Court finds factual basis does exist. Court accepts plea, finds DE GUILTY on both counts and orders entry of judgment. Court imposes:

Ct 1- sentence withheld, 18 mo probation
Conditions:
$100 fine plus costs
$200 DNAAS plus sample
AODA

Ct 2- sentence withheld, 18 mo probation
Conditions:
$243 fine
$200 DNAAS
AODA

0 days jail credit

Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:00 AM Defendant Allen M. Walber appeared in court via video from Price COunty Jail. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he does not believe he has recieved a criminal complaint in this matter. Court states there was a certificate of service filed in the case, further reading waived.  Notice of right to attorney given to DE.   DE enters plea of GUILTY to all counts. Court explains a guilty plea will need further discussions defendant is excused will be back on record later this morning. Back on record at 10:26 AM appearances are as previously stated. Court questions defendant on the plea he entered earlier this morning. Defendant states he no longer desires to enter a guilty plea, defendant ponders his decision and changes his mind to still enter a guilty plea. This matter will be set for a plea and sentencing hearing for 04/06/2022 at 11:00 AM. Bond is already set in this matter and is to continue.
Initial appearance on April 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:19 AM Defendant Allen M. Walber not in court.  Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over the case and states the notice for today's hearing has not been sent back undeliverable. DA Kelz moves for a warrant in the amount of $750. So ordered plus warrant fee.
Demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA
